alert.note: Alert for Western Siskiyou County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 31 at 8:24PM PDT until April 03 at 11:00AM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 11 AM PDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations 8 to 16 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...The mountains of Western Siskiyou County. * WHEN...From 11 PM this evening to 11 AM PDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is imminent and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.
